articles.headline: California Senate Passes Bill to Regulate Fast-Food Industry
articles.snippet: If signed by Gov. Gavin Newsom, the measure would create a state council to establish minimum pay and safety conditions on an industrywide basis.
articles.abstract: If signed by Gov. Gavin Newsom, the measure would create a state council to establish minimum pay and safety conditions on an industrywide basis.
articles.lead_paragraph: The California State Senate passed a bill on Monday that could transform the way the service sector is regulated by creating a council to set wages and improve working conditions for fast-food workers.

articles.headline: Biden’s Student Loan Plan Sets Off Fierce Debate Among Economists
articles.snippet: Liberals and more moderate Democrats are arguing over the impact on inflation, the federal budget deficit and high earners.
articles.abstract: Liberals and more moderate Democrats are arguing over the impact on inflation, the federal budget deficit and high earners.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden’s plan to forgive some student debt has sharply divided liberal economists and pitted the White House economic team against both independent analysts and veterans of past Democratic administrations.

articles.headline: Death in Navy SEAL Training Exposes a Culture of Brutality, Cheating and Drugs
articles.snippet: The elite force’s selection course is so punishing that few make it through, and many of those who do resort to illicit tactics.
articles.abstract: The elite force’s selection course is so punishing that few make it through, and many of those who do resort to illicit tactics.
articles.lead_paragraph: CORONADO, Calif. — Kyle Mullen always had the natural drive and talent that made success look easy. Until he tried out for the Navy SEALs.

articles.headline: Sweeping Children’s Online Safety Bill Is Passed in California
articles.snippet: The new rules, which would require many online services to increase protections for children, could change how popular social media and game platforms treat minors.
articles.abstract: The new rules, which would require many online services to increase protections for children, could change how popular social media and game platforms treat minors.
articles.lead_paragraph: Social media and game platforms often use recommendation algorithms, find-a-friend tools, smartphone notices and other enticements to keep people glued online. But the same techniques may pose risks to scores of children who have flocked to online services that were not specifically designed for them.

articles.headline: How German Companies Are Staring Down Putin’s Threat to Cut Off Gas
articles.snippet: Industrial producers across Germany are coming up with unique ways to cut their dependence on natural gas as Russia’s war in Ukraine keeps prices high.
articles.abstract: Industrial producers across Germany are coming up with unique ways to cut their dependence on natural gas as Russia’s war in Ukraine keeps prices high.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the weeks after Russia invaded Ukraine, German lawmakers cautiously proposed ways to cut their country’s ties to Russian natural gas. The heads of some of Germany’s leading industrial companies, long reliant on Russian gas, wanted no part of it.

articles.headline: Mississippi’s Capital Loses Water as a Troubled System Faces a Fresh Crisis
articles.snippet: In Jackson, residents have long contended with boil-water notices and service disruptions. But now, officials say, the system has been pushed to the brink.
articles.abstract: In Jackson, residents have long contended with boil-water notices and service disruptions. But now, officials say, the system has been pushed to the brink.
articles.lead_paragraph: JACKSON, Miss. — More than 150,000 people in Mississippi’s capital were without access to safe drinking water on Tuesday, forcing officials to tackle what they described as the “massively complicated task” of distributing bottled water and devising a plan to restore service without a firm sense of how long that would take.

articles.headline: A Frontline Shadow Economy: Ukrainian Units Swap Tanks and Artillery
articles.snippet: Most of the bartering involves items captured from Russian troops, which are exchanged for urgently needed supplies. “Let’s just call it a simplification of bureaucracy,” one soldier said.
articles.abstract: Most of the bartering involves items captured from Russian troops, which are exchanged for urgently needed supplies. “Let’s just call it a simplification of bureaucracy,” one soldier said.
articles.lead_paragraph: DONETSK REGION, Ukraine — The Ukrainian sergeant slid the captured Russian rocket launcher into the center of a small room. He was pleased. The weapon was practically brand-new. It had been built in 2020, and its thermobaric warhead was deadly against troops and armored vehicles.

articles.headline: Google Employee Who Played Key Role in Protest of Contract With Israel Quits
articles.snippet: The worker said the company had tried to retaliate against her activism opposing a deal with the Israeli military, while co-workers argued the company had an anti-Palestinian bias.
articles.abstract: The worker said the company had tried to retaliate against her activism opposing a deal with the Israeli military, while co-workers argued the company had an anti-Palestinian bias.
articles.lead_paragraph: A Google employee who became the most visible opponent of a company contract with the Israeli military said on Tuesday that she would resign after claiming Google had tried to retaliate against her for her activism.
